snippet: Officials said they had found evidence that the man, born in Egypt, went to great lengths to hide his extensive online communications with suspected Islamic State operatives overseas.
abstract: Mohamed Elshinawy of Maryland is arrested for allegedly attempting to aid Islamic State in domestic terrorist attack; Federal Bureau of Investigation agents say Elshinawy received more than $8,000 from ISIS over past five months.

byline.contributor: Susan Beachy contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Officials said they had found evidence that the man, born in Egypt, went to great lengths to hide his extensive online communications with suspected Islamic State operatives overseas.

headline.main: Maryland Man Accused of Tapping Money From ISIS Operatives for a U.S. Attack
headline.print_headline: Maryland Man Accused of Tapping Money From ISIS Operatives for a U.S. Attack

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
